name: Amit Kumar
notes:
1. Prescribed 10mg Zolpidem tablets to be taken once daily at bedtime.
  2. Recommended sleep hygiene practices including maintaining a regular sleep schedule.
  3. Advised to avoid caffeine and heavy meals before bedtime.
  4. Suggested relaxation techniques such as meditation or a warm bath before bed.
  5. Follow-up in two weeks to assess effectiveness and make any necessary adjustments.

name: Sita Sharma
notes:
1. Advised daily multivitamin supplements and a balanced diet rich in iron.
  2. Recommended regular light exercise, such as walking for 30 minutes a day.
  3. Encouraged to maintain a consistent sleep schedule and practice good sleep hygiene.
  4. Suggested reducing stress through activities like yoga or meditation.
  5. Follow-up in one month to monitor energy levels and overall well-being.

name: Lakshmi Nair
notes:
1. Prescribed 500mg Amoxicillin tablets to be taken thrice daily for 7 days.
  2. Advised to stay hydrated and use throat lozenges to soothe throat irritation.
  3. Recommended gargling with warm salt water several times a day.
  4. Suggested avoiding irritants such as smoking and alcohol.
  5. Follow-up if no improvement or if symptoms worsen within a week.

name: Ramesh Gupta
notes:
1. Prescribed 5mg Loratadine tablets once daily for allergy symptom relief.
  2. Advised to use saline nasal spray as needed to clear nasal passages.
  3. Recommended keeping windows closed during high pollen days to minimize exposure.
  4. Suggested washing bedding frequently to reduce dust mites.
  5. Follow-up if symptoms do not improve or if new symptoms develop.

name: Anita Singh
notes:
1. Prescribed 10mg Cetirizine tablets once daily to manage allergy symptoms.
  2. Advised to keep windows closed during high pollen periods and use an air purifier.
  3. Recommended washing clothes and showering after being outdoors.
  4. Suggested using a humidifier to maintain optimal indoor humidity levels.
  5. Follow-up if symptoms persist or if any side effects occur.

name: Manoj Patel
notes:
1. Prescribed 250mg Erythromycin tablets to be taken thrice daily for 7 days.
  2. Advised to rest and drink warm fluids like herbal tea with honey.
  3. Recommended using throat lozenges or sprays to soothe irritation.
  4. Suggested avoiding irritants such as smoke and strong odors.
  5. Follow-up if no improvement or if symptoms worsen within a week.

name: Bharat Desai
notes:
1. Prescribed 500mg Paracetamol tablets to be taken every 6 hours to reduce fever.
  2. Advised to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids.
  3. Recommended rest and avoiding strenuous activities until fever subsides.
  4. Suggested using a cool compress to alleviate discomfort.
  5. Follow-up if fever persists for more than 3 days or if symptoms worsen.
